thread.title: 'I want my licence fee back' - EastEnders viewers slam the soap's 'endless' pancake race
thread.title_full: 'I want my licence fee back' - EastEnders viewers slam the soap's 'endless' pancake race

author: Joshua Haigh
title: 'I want my licence fee back' - EastEnders viewers slam the soap's 'endless' pancake race
text:
Fans are tired of the 'stale' soap Share Get soaps   Could   
EastEnders viewers have had enough of the soap. 
After complaining that the show had become more like Grange Hill recently, viewers rushed to social media tonight in the middle of the latest episode's drama for all the wrong reasons. 
Albert Square was busy having a pancake race - which was planned throughout the episode - and by the time it came about, Twitter was already bored of the whole thing. 
Ian Beale even ended up collapsing, but it wasn't enough to entertain fans. Ian collapsed during the race (Photo: BBC) Viewers got bored quickly (Photo: BBC) 
"I wonder how much interaction with reality the writers of #EastEnders actually have when I watch episodes like tonight with the pancake race," said one bored viewer. 
A second fan said: "Very few things to look forward to on #eastenders" 
These endings are getting so bad #Eastenders," added a third angry viewer. 
Another called for producer Sean O'Connor to be fired, saying: "#EastEnders need to get rid of their producer Sean O'Connor. I have never known the show to be this bad in 25+ years of watching..."
